body_html:
I would be interested in having full support of the cuDNN library through the stream executor and all the goodies that comes with it. Expose all the endpoints in the cudnn layer and only few to the public layer.

@zheng-xq did the problem with cudnnRNN got solved at the end? When I tried the wrapping I wasn't sure where to store the temporary variables required by the cudnn library.

I would be interested in having full support of the cuDNN library through the stream executor and all the goodies that comes with it. Expose all the endpoints in the cudnn layer and only few to the public layer.

body:
I would be interested in having full support of the cuDNN library through the stream executor and all the goodies that comes with it. Expose all the endpoints in the cudnn layer and only few to the public layer. 

@zheng-xq  did the problem with cudnnRNN got solved at the end? When I tried the wrapping I wasn't sure where to store the temporary variables required by the cudnn library.
